page.title: 17RURAL MEDICINE, ST.ALLEN.
page.content: People in the area can register with any of 4 medical practices,2 of which are based in Truro & 1 in each of the villages of Chacewater & Probus.There are no branch surgeries in this area, & very little public transport,so patients need their own transport to attend a doctor's surgery.Emergencies are dealt with by the doctor or ambulance attending the patient.The winding lanes make journeys relatively slow,& this situation is much worse when tourists are travelling the single-track lanes in summer.Farm machines at silage,hay,& harvest times are another hazard which may seriously delay emergency vehicles. Cornish farming people are very stoical,& do not seek medical help usually until they are unable to work.They tend to be self-sufficient & healthy people.
